titles.title: Agricultural Air Quality Incentives Act of 2007
A bill to amend the Food Security Act of 1985 to provide incentives for improved agricultural air quality.
Agricultural Air Quality Incentives Act of 2007

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry.

term.name: Federal aid to air pollution control

bill.summary:
Agricultural Air Quality Incentives Act of 2007 - Amends the Food Security Act of 1985 to direct the Secretary of Agriculture to: (1) promote air quality by providing cost-share payments and incentive payments to individual producers to address agricultural air quality concerns; and (2) provide cost-share payments to producers for mobile or stationary equipment (including engines) used in an agricultural operation that would reduce emissions of air pollutants and air pollutant precursors.
Requires a project to be in a county: (1) that is in nonattainment under the Clean Air Act with respect to ambient air quality standards for ozone, particulate matter, or both; (2) in which there is air quality degradation to which agricultural emissions significantly contribute; or (3) in which pesticide drift is a priority concern.
Sets forth project priority criteria.
